Maybe like Half Breeds like Paladin, which is a mixure of a cleric and
Soldier, or a ranger, which is a mix of Soldier and druid, of course to
balance the characters, you'll have to weaken both powers

----- Original Message -----
From: Tom Tildrum <Tevildo@...>
To: <gladiator@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, June 27, 2001 8:15 AM
Subject: [gladiator] Chain lightning and half-classes


> Call me paranoid, but in my case I think the chain lightning freeze-up is
> caused by the amount of memory allocated to running Gladiator. Sometimes
> I'll have other programs running in the background and I can chain fifty
> guys with no problem; sometimes I run it totally by itself from DOS and it
> takes half an hour for the lightning to cycle through fifteen guys. I
don't
> have the fastest computer, but it shouldn't be crippled by something like
> that.
>
> Something I've noticed: one of the only other things that will slow down
> Gladiator is having a whole hell of a lot of elemental fire on the screen.
> But that's ONLY if the fire is on the screen where you can see it. Once
you
> stop sunbursting and the flames reach the edge of the visible field
> everything speeds up again. Usually this lag isn't significant, but it's
> noticeable.
>
> Half-classes made by merging two preexisting characters? How do you
propose
> to make that thematic? "The orc tears viciously into the druid, devouring
> his flesh and gaining his skills!" or "After undergoing horrific
operations,
> the Archer finally healed... his old skeleton entirely removed and
replaced
> with the reanimated skeleton of a dead man." or "The thief successfully
> stole the archmage's staff and cloak." I don't see how this could
reasonably
> be introduced, but I'm open to suggestions.
>      -T.
>
